title: gzserver: add command-line option for spawning a model file

content.raw:
Currently a world file can be passed as an argument to gzserver, but model files cannot. You can use `gz model` to spawn a model from a file after loading `gzserver`, but that requires multiple commands. You can also add a model folder to `~/.gazebo/models` or some other place in the `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`, but that requires creating a model.config and possibly fussing with environment variables.

I think this is useful because there are many times someone just wants to test out a model file, and we should try to make that painless.

Perhaps using the same parameter name as `gz model`:

~~~
gzserver --spawn-file filename
~~~
